newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Netanyahu to meet Arafat, Mubarak on Sunday, aide.
newsitem.headline: Netanyahu to meet Arafat, Mubarak on Sunday, aide.

text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will hold meetings with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat and Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak on Sunday, when the three attend an economic forum in a Swiss resort, an aide said.
The leaders are expected to share a platform for a discussion of the Middle East at the World Economic Forum in Davos on Sunday, February 2.

Asked if the prime minister would meet the Egyptian and Palestinian presidents during the conference, Netanyahu aide Shai Bazak told Reuters on Wednesday: "Separate meetings have been set with both for Sunday."
Bazak declined to elaborate on topics to be discussed.
Middle East peace prospects brightened this month with Israel's pullout from most of the West Bank town of Hebron, a move the Jewish state had long delayed for security fears.

Differences with the PLO and Egypt over a Hebron accord kept Netanyahu away from a Middle East and North Africa economic conference sponsored by the Geneva-based Forum last November in Cairo, an event at which Israel was largely sidelined.

The White House said on Wednesday the leaders of Israel, the Palestinians, Egypt and Jordan will hold separate talks in Washington with President Clinton in the next two months, beginning with Netanyahu on February 13.
